docs.snippet: LEAD: President Bush is expected to announce this week that the United States will begin preparing for free-trade talks with Mexico, senior Administration officials said over the weekend.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: President Bush is expected to announce this week that the United States will begin preparing for free-trade talks with Mexico, senior Administration officials said over the weekend.

byline.original: By CLYDE H. FARNSWORTH, Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: Diego Maradona may have touched the ball with his arm to block a shot tonight in an echo of his famous ''hand of God'' goal against England in 1986 World Cup play as Argentina, the defending champion, beat the Soviet Union, 2-0.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Diego Maradona may have touched the ball with his arm to block a shot tonight in an echo of his famous ''hand of God'' goal against England in 1986 World Cup play as Argentina, the defending champion, beat the Soviet Union, 2-0.

byline.original: By GEORGE VECSEY, Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: The owner of a pizzeria in Brooklyn who had stayed after closing to discuss renovations with his partner and a contractor was fatally shot late Tuesday when he surprised two men who were robbing his associates outside the shop, the police said.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The owner of a pizzeria in Brooklyn who had stayed after closing to discuss renovations with his partner and a contractor was fatally shot late Tuesday when he surprised two men who were robbing his associates outside the shop, the police said.

headline.main: Merchant Slain Trying to Stop Armed Robbery

docs.snippet: LEAD: Although India has refused to negotiate removal of trade barriers with the United States, the Bush Administration has ruled out sanctions against New Delhi lest broader trade liberalization talks be undermined, American trade officials said...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Although India has refused to negotiate removal of trade barriers with the United States, the Bush Administration has ruled out sanctions against New Delhi lest broader trade liberalization talks be undermined, American trade officials said today.

headline.main: U.S. Likely to Forgo Sanctions Against India

byline.original: By CLYDE H. FARNSWORTH, Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD:    TENNIS       Garrison Advances    Top-seeded Zina Garrison beat France's Catherine Suire, 7-5, 6-2, in the second round of the Dow Classic tournament at Birmingham, England, yesterday. Helena Sukova of Czechoslovakia, seeded second, defeated...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: TENNIS Garrison Advances Top-seeded Zina Garrison beat France's Catherine Suire, 7-5, 6-2, in the second round of the Dow Classic tournament at Birmingham, England, yesterday. Helena Sukova of Czechoslovakia, seeded second, defeated Cecilia Dahlman of Sweden, 6-3, 6-2, to also advance in the grass-court warmup for Wimbledon.(AP) Duncan and Carbonell Advance: Lawson Duncan of the United States and Tomas Carbonell of Spain had straight set victories at the Florence International tournament in Italy yesterday.

docs.snippet: LEAD: The Bush Administration said today, as expected, that it would not impose economic sanctions on India for trade barriers the United States deems offensive.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Bush Administration said today, as expected, that it would not impose economic sanctions on India for trade barriers the United States deems offensive.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Ireland missed a number of scoring opportunities in the second half today and was held to a 0-0 tie by Egypt. The tie was the fourth in four games in Group F of the World Cup competition.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Ireland missed a number of scoring opportunities in the second half today and was held to a 0-0 tie by Egypt. The tie was the fourth in four games in Group F of the World Cup competition.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Joining a group of American companies lining up to enter India under liberalized investment laws, Corning Inc. disclosed that it was ready to go ahead with a joint venture with a local partner to manufacture glass bulbs for television picture...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Joining a group of American companies lining up to enter India under liberalized investment laws, Corning Inc. disclosed that it was ready to go ahead with a joint venture with a local partner to manufacture glass bulbs for television picture tubes.

headline.main: Corning Set To Pursue India Venture

byline.original: By BARBARA CROSSETTE, Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: World trade negotiators tentatively agreed today that countries should list all charges in addition to fixed tariffs that importers must pay.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: World trade negotiators tentatively agreed today that countries should list all charges in addition to fixed tariffs that importers must pay.

keywords.value: GENERAL AGREEMENT ON TARIFFS AND TRADE

docs.snippet: LEAD: The first round of the World Cup finals ended tonight with yellow balls, red balls and giant brandy snifters setting matchups for the 16 teams that will begin an elimination tournament on Saturday leading to the final on July 8 in Rome.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The first round of the World Cup finals ended tonight with yellow balls, red balls and giant brandy snifters setting matchups for the 16 teams that will begin an elimination tournament on Saturday leading to the final on July 8 in Rome.

headline.main: For 16 World Cup Teams, 'Real' Contest Is Beginning

byline.original: By MICHAEL JANOFSKY, Special to The New York Times
